Francesco Mazzola, Italian Artist, Madonna with the Long Neck, 1534

Image 2

Quentin Massys, Dutch artist, Madonna and Child, circa 1520

Detroit Institute of Arts, USAGift of James E. Scripps/Bridgeman Images
content.question: Which of the following groups most frequently commissioned Mannerist and Baroque art during the 1500s?

choices.label: Monarchs and other rulers who sought to enhance their stature
Military commanders who sought to inspire their soldiers
Middle-class artists who sought to decorate their homes
Protestant reformers who sought to convert Roman Catholics

content.answer: Monarchs and other rulers who sought to enhance their stature

topic.text: 2.7: Art of the 16th Century: Mannerism and Baroque Art

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
